detailed_info.name: Benzyl alcohol
detailed_info.description: Benzyl alcohol is one of the allergens regulated by Europe. It is mostly used as a preservative. It is naturally present in many plants and fruits, including Jasmine, garlic and Ylang-Ylang, as well as apricot, almond, apple and blackcurrant... Benzyl alcohol is authorized in organic farming.
detailed_info.regulation:
The maximum permitted concentrations are:
a) Solvent
b) Perfume and aromatic compositions, their raw materials

For purposes other than inhibiting the development of microorganisms in the product. This purpose must be apparent from the presentation of the product.

(b) The presence of the substance must be indicated on the list of ingredients referred to in point (g) of Article 19 (1) when its concentration is higher:
- 0.001% in products without rinsing,
- 0.01% in the products to be rinsed.

functions.name: Preservative
functions.description: Inhibits the development of microorganisms in cosmetic products.

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

functions.name: Perfuming
functions.description: Used for perfume and aromatic raw materials

special_mentions.label: Bonus if present in essential oils
